warp.name: Warp
warp.description: Warp is a keyword ability that allows a player to cast a spell for its warp cost rather than its mana cost. When a player warps a spell, they may pay the warp cost instead of the mana cost. The spell is then exiled with a warp counter on it. The player may cast the exiled spell for its warp cost until the end of their next turn.
warp.example: Warp {2} (You may pay {2} rather than pay this spell's mana cost. If you do, exile it with a warp counter on it. You may cast it for its warp cost until the end of your next turn.)
rulings: If you cast a spell for its warp cost, it goes to exile instead of your graveyard as it resolves.
You can only cast the exiled spell once from exile using warp.
If the spell is countered after being cast for its warp cost, it still goes to exile.
The warp ability only works from your hand, not from other zones.

menace.name: Menace
menace.description: Menace is a keyword ability that makes a creature harder to block. A creature with menace can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
menace.example: This creature has menace. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
rulings: If a creature has multiple instances of menace, it's still just 'can't be blocked except by two or more creatures'.
Menace doesn't interact with abilities that prevent blocking, such as 'can't be blocked'.
